page.title: 08OUR LOCAL CHURCH
page.content: Parish Church of{St.John The Divine, } Chevington was built in 1858.The church cost Â£1,200.This money was donated by Henry Earl Grey (Â£1.100)and Addison John Baker Esq of Cresswell gave (Â£100.)The church is made out of black dolomite whinstone from the local quarry.The chancel and vestry was bulit in 1893,and cost Â£658.The church is lucky enough to have two organs built by Harrison and Harrison of Durham.During the war,St.John's was used as an airforce church,for all the servicemen from Acklington, since then the congragation has slowly decreased, and now it is at an all time low.
